articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made liberal use of the word "careful" at his last press conference as he described the U.S. central bank's effort to balance the risks of still-elevated inflation and a surprise surge in economic growth against tightening credit conditions and a Fed conviction that the economy was on the cusp of slowing.
articles.title: Fed minutes likely to anchor 'careful' approach to policy

articles.author: Ludwig Burger, Eva Mathews
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) will ration starter kits of Ozempic in Europe and reduce supplies of another diabetes drug, Victoza, to prioritise producing Ozempic, which has seen a surge in demand from people using it to lose weight.
articles.title: Novo rations Ozempic starter kits amid surge in use for weight loss

articles.author: Diane Bartz
articles.description: A group of 27 U.S. lawmakers, all Democrats, wrote to X owner Elon Musk on Tuesday to express concern the platform seemed to be profiting from premium accounts that glorified violence against Israelis.
articles.title: U.S. lawmakers accuse X chief Musk of profiting from anti-Israel propaganda

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's major state-owned banks were seen exchanging yuan for U.S. dollars in the onshore swap market and selling those dollars in spot currency markets this week, two sources told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: China's state banks seen swapping and selling dollars for yuan - sources

articles.author: Savyata Mishra, Ananya Mariam Rajesh
articles.description: U.S. retailers across apparel, electronics and home improvement are bracing for a challenging holiday season, a sign that higher discounts might not spark the level of spending the companies are hoping for during their most important period of the year.
articles.title: US retailers brace for a tough holiday season despite discounts

articles.author: Nell Mackenzie, Akanksha Khushi
articles.description: A key bond of CPI Property Group (O5G.DE) fell by the most on record on Tuesday after short-selling hedge fund Muddy Waters said it had bet against the credit of the Luxembourg-based commercial landlord.
articles.title: Muddy Waters shorts CPI Property Group credit; bonds slammed

articles.author: David Milliken
articles.description: Britain's minimum wage will increase by 9.8% to 11.44 pounds ($14.26) an hour from April 2024, making it one of the highest as a share of average earnings of any advanced economy.
articles.title: Britain to raise minimum wage by 9.8% to 11.44 pounds an hour

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: The United States believes that Israel and Hamas are getting closer to a deal that would secure the release of some hostages held in Gaza, even as the Israeli military's deadly assault on Gaza City continued and rockets were being fired into Israel.
articles.title: White House says Israel, Hamas hostage deal closer than before

articles.author: Chris Prentice, David Lawder, Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Binance chief Changpeng Zhao will step down and plead guilty to breaking criminal U.S. anti-money laundering laws as part of a $4 billion settlement resolving a years-long probe into the world's largest crypto exchange, prosecutors said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Binance's Zhao to plead guilty, step down to settle US illicit finance probe

articles.author: James Pearson
articles.description: Using fake names, sham LinkedIn profiles, counterfeit work papers and mock interview scripts, North Korean IT workers seeking employment in Western tech companies are deploying sophisticated subterfuge to get hired.
articles.title: North Koreans use fake names, scripts to land remote IT work for cash
